item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, December 19, 2024 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Developing Developers (2015) (82 points | 25 comments)
2. Solaar is a Linux manager for many Logitech keyboards, mice, and other devices (466 points | 195 comments)
3. Want to book a Ryanair flight? Prepare for a face scan (33 points | 30 comments)
4. Show HN: Postgres as a VectorDB GUI (105 points | 13 comments)
5. Markov Keyboard: keyboard layout that changes by Markov frequency (2019) (111 points | 61 comments)
6. Firenvim – Turn the browser into a Neovim client (101 points | 19 comments)
7. Borrow Checking, RC, GC, and Eleven Other Memory Safety Approaches (73 points | 31 comments)
8. Piccolo OS, a Small Multitasking OS for the Raspberry Pi Pico (117 points | 15 comments)
9. ISO 8583: The language of credit cards (313 points | 58 comments)
10. Kowloon Walled City: Heterotopia in a Space of Disappearance (2013) (8 points | discuss)
11. Self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in minimal intelligence (133 points | 45 comments)
12. Our brains create mental "chapters" with new event segmentation study (105 points | 8 comments)
13. Blackmagic Debuts $30K 3D Camera for Capturing Video for Vision Pro (52 points | 41 comments)
14. Exposing the Clearingstelle Urheberrecht Im Internet (CUII) (107 points | 20 comments)
15. Genesis – a generative physics engine for general-purpose robotics (82 points | 20 comments)
16. Apple Watch with Android (179 points | 109 comments)
17. The RAM Myth (114 points | 78 comments)
18. Error Stacking in Rust (85 points | 32 comments)
19. Updates to H-1B (363 points | 1005 comments)
20. Launch HN: Innate (YC F24) – Home robots as easy to program as AI agents (140 points | 63 comments)
21. Alignment faking in large language models (115 points | 92 comments)
22. Amazon workers to strike at multiple US warehouses during busy holiday season (143 points | 90 comments)
23. Moon (2931 points | 241 comments)
24. Torpedo juice: Legendary, illegal WWII liquor drunk in Alaska and the world (56 points | 30 comments)
25. Half My Life with Perl (107 points | 60 comments)
26. There's No Such Thing as Software Productivity (2012) (100 points | 96 comments)
27. Analyzing the World Chess Championship 2024: Empirical synthesized approach (27 points | 30 comments)
28. Embedding Lua in Sqleibniz with Rust (47 points | 1 comment)
29. Khalid Sheldrake: The East Dulwich man who would be King (37 points | 24 comments)
30. Windshield pitting incidents in Washington reach fever pitch on April 15, 1954 (2003) (300 points | 251 comments)
